author: .paulharris
content:
<@!602753420033785856> Teku team had a chat about how we might handle the config spec issue - we can remove the altair constants if needed but it really only delays the problem until whenever it gets enabled.  
Our theory is that validators need to know the altair config prior to altair being live, otherwise we'll be needing frequent config calls to ensure we're not missing config. 
Design wise it probably needs to be permissive for these kinds of changes, so that we don't hit this issue for every config change into the future...
Did you want us to filter the extra fields for now?

author: sproul
content: We're changing Lighthouse to be more permissive, so no need to change Teku I think. You're right that having the HF config ahead of time is essential, so serving it makes sense.
